title: How to Make a Bookmark Out of Clear Tape

steps.headline: Obtain clear tape.
steps.description: Packing tape, Scotch tape or Sellotape or any clear tape.

steps.headline: Choose your base picture.
steps.description: This can be cut from a magazine cover or hand-drawn. The only real consideration here is that it should be taller than it is wide, and the narrower it is, the easier it will be to use in a book.

steps.headline: Cut out the picture carefully.
steps.description: Try to cut the sides in perfectly smooth lines. Straight lines tend to slide into a book best, but you could conceivably make any shape of bookmark that you want this way. (ie: star, heart, squiggly, whatever.)

steps.headline: Lay the picture on a flat surface.
Cover the picture in two layers of clear tape.
steps.description: One layer horizontal with edges of the tape overlapping and one layer vertical, again with edges of the tape overlapping each other.

steps.headline: Peel up the picture and tape from the flat surface and turn it over.
Repeat the taping process for the reverse side.
Cut away excess tape from the edges of your picture.
steps.description: Leave a quarter inch margin to seal out water to protect your picture.

steps.headline: Punch a hole in one end for a ribbon or string if desired.

tyn: Picture on paper (preferably somewhat stiff paper, but any paper will work)
